intro: Alyxia bracteolosa var. macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. The plant produces large, woody fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in desert ecosystems.
